entry.title: Re: In EPPM, what's the accrual revenue calculation metho...
entry.content:
Hi @Ken_Melching,

Thanks a lot for your reply, can we discuss this topic by an example?

Below screenshots came from the G/L line item of  Event-Based Revenue Recognition - Projects  app. and project actual/plan app for a billing element.

Base on them, I came up with an excel to calculate the posting logic, please find it below. the total Plan revenue and Plan cost are 22,988.52 and 11,494.26. I calculated the POC of 2 postings on 9A40000004 - Materials_Products_Out, I found the POC was base on the plan cost of 9A40000004(4,597.71), but not total Plan cost. the outcome are 271.8496 and 3576.145 individually, which are equal to the amounts on 272.03 and 3,576.25 on 1D01000090 (Contract Assets), please check them in the excel below.

So my question is there is no plan cost on 9C25000001 - Exp._Other Subcontracting Exp, 9Y10000004 - Cost Alloc.(Labor)_Wages_Employee. entry.title: Re: Getting Started with SAP BTP Forms Service by Adobe (On-Premise)
entry.content:
Hi @HRG0707 

Is it possible to call Adobe Form Service API from the custom action logic of Custom App (that is created by In-App/Key User Extensibility) and print form template in S4Hana cloud.

Our scenario is

1. Create Custom App by In-App/Key User Extensibility in S4Hana cloud

2. Create new action in Custom App

3. Custom App will be exposed as OData API to Adobe Form Service

4. Create Custom Template using Adobe Lifecycle Designer and Adobe Form Service

5. Call Adobe Form Service from action logic of Custom app and print Form Template

 

Could you please suggest that is that possible to do so?

 

Best Regards

Aye Chan

entry.title: Request for Official List of Email Notification Domains from SAP
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

 

I would like to request the official list of email domains used by SAP for system-generated notifications, alerts, and other communications (for example, from SAP Cloud ALM, SuccessFactors, Ariba, Concur, or other SAP cloud platforms).

 

Our IT security team is reviewing our mail-gateway allowlist to ensure that legitimate SAP notification emails are not blocked or quarantined. Could you please share:

 

  1.  

  2. The current sender domain list (e.g., @SAP.com, @Ariba.com, etc.) used for email notifications across SAP cloud services; and

  3.  

  4. Any SAP Knowledge Base Article (KBA) or official documentation reference that details these sender domains and any regional variations (e.g., for APJ, EU, US).

 

If the list differs by product, please indicate the correct reference or contact point for each applicable product.

 

Thank you for your assistance.

 

Best regards,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Request for Official List of Email Notification Domai...
entry.content:
Regarding to your questions, please refer to KBA 3481022 - Different types of notifications - SAP for Me

Abstract below information for your reference:

Support-related Notifications

  • Notifications about various applications in SAP for Me, e.g. customer cases, SAP Notes & KBAs, User Management, SAP HotNews, Service Requests, license key, legal change announcement, SAP Passport, etc. 
  • Subscription is configured in Support-Related Notifications application (KBA 2530034)
  • Notifications come from email box notification-service@sap.com

Cloud System maintenance/outage/downtime Notifications

  • Notifications about incidents (service disruptions, degradations) and scheduled maintenance and upgrade events occurring with cloud products
  • Visit page Supported Products to check the supported cloud products and system types
  • Subscription is configured in Cloud Systems Notification Subscriptions (Get Notified) application (KBA 2896942 and 2900069)
  • Notifications come from email box sapcloudsupport@alerts.ondemand.com

SAP for Me Status Notifications

  • Notifications about the service availability and overall performance of SAP for Me
  • Subscription is configured in SAP for Me Status Page (KBA 2507656)
  • Notifications come from email box noreply@statuspage.io

entry.title: Bank Account Mandatory without Removing Delete Permission from Onboarding External User
entry.content:
We are exploring ways to make bank account number required for onboardees in Personal Data Collection, without removing the delete functionality. Is there a way to do this? SAP Note 3076751 walks through making fields mandatory, but states that the delete permission must be removed.

Our main issue with removing delete functionality from for the onboardee is that some countries are only allowed to submit one payment method. If they start an additional bank without being able to remove, they will receive an error that they can only have one bank, and wouldn't be able to proceed. They would be forced to refresh and lose all of the data previously entered, leading to a very poor user experience.

entry.title: Re: Production variance settlement to CO-PA (instead of C...
entry.content:
Good day @JavierIbanez 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Event-Based Reporting, Settlement Rules of Manufacturing Orders (Event-Based Posting Rules)

SAP Central Finance & Margin Analysis (new COPA), Cost Elements

Universal Allocation in SAP S/4HANA 2022, Universal Allocation

Answer to question 1: No, in public cloud Substitutions/settlement redirections for production variances to a cost center (like on-prem) are not supported. PRD --> CO-PA is what the system permits.

Answer to question 2: You can keep the technical prices cost center at zero without manual CO-PA JE by using Universal Allocation. The sender must equal the cost center, whilst excluding PRD G/Ls. Receiver must equal Profitability Segment. You have to schedule monthly. This yields automatic clearing and avoids double-counting PRD.

Answer to question 3: Today, this is not supported in public cloud due to its clean-core approach. If it is critical, i suggest you submit a request via the Customer Influence channel.

Here is a step by step guide.

Search Margin Analysis-Line Items -->

Filter by G/L Account (PRD accounts & Posting Period) --> Confirm entries show Profitability Segment (PSG)

To confirm which G/Ls are PRD vs. non-PRD on your technical prices cost center, go to Display Line Items in General Ledger --> Filter Cost center= technical prices, Period, and G/L range involved. Identify which G/Ls are PRD and which are other ML/price-diff balances you need to allocate. Exclude PRD G/Ls from the allocation sender selection.

Ensure you have a secondary cost element for allocation. Open Manage G/L Account Master Data --> create or check a G/L type to be used by Universal Allocation.

Thereafter, Open Manage Allocation to defined Universal Allocation --> Create Cycle Ã  Category= Overhead Allocation or Assessment. Segment-Sender: Sender Object= Cost Center. Sender Filter on G/L Account= include non PRD G/Ls only. Segment-Receiver: Receiver Object= Profitability Segment (Use your CO-PA characteristics). Tracing Factor: choose an appropriate basis. Allocation Cost Element: choose the secondary cost element from previous step. The purpose is to automate clearing of non-PRD balances from the CC to CO-PA, leaving the CC at zero without touching the PRD again.

Test Run the cycle for the period, if correct then execute productive run. Review the Allocation Results link. This confirms postings clear the cost center and flow to CO-PA automatically

Next is to validate the technical prices. Open Cost Center-Actuals and filter the CC and period after the run.

Finally, you need to schedule each period. Open Manage Allocation, schedule your cycle monthly. This avoids manual postings by keeping FI and CO reconciled period-end.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Automatic consumption of consignment stock for production order components using 261 movement
entry.content: I think, you have to set the components in backflush in order to automatically consume the items when doing 261 transactions otherwise, it will not automatically consume the components even if it goes through 261. If you are using MIGO to do manual 261, you can manually input the components you want to consume even if they are not set to backflush.

entry.title: Re: Tableau Connection with S/4HANA public Cloud
entry.content:
Good day @shahidiqbal 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

SAP KBA 3609991, https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/examples_odata.htm

Blog: Table access in S/4HANA Cloud

In summary, the public cloud does not allow you to connect Tableau directly to the public cloud. However, it provides a connection possibility through standard OData APIs. You can use Communication Arrangement, Communication User and OData URL (that you can past into Tableauâ€™s connector).

The reason for the restriction is, in the public cloud, SAP restricts database-level access to protect security, maintaining upgrade stability and enforce the clean-core approach upon which the public cloud SaaS model was built. Therefore, restricting access to released APIs or CDS views.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SEN Content database available after contract duration
entry.content:
Hi Maggy,

Approximately 3 months after the Enable Now contract has been terminated, the Enable Now tenant is permanently deleted.  Prior to that point, individual customers must extract whatever information that they wish to keep from their environment.  Once the tenant has been deleted, there is no way for SAP to restore that content if the customer changes their mind in the future.

The options to extract the content from your Enable Now system are discussed in the following information sessions:

US friendly time
Registration page (Nov 7)

APAC friendly time
Registration page (Dec 3)

European friendly time
Registration page (Dec 3)

Regards
Shane

entry.title: SAP Document AI in SAP MDG using Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM)
entry.content:
Introduction

In this blog, let us understand how to leverage SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) to manage Generative AI and AI business services in the SAP MDG. This blog mainly focuses on how to use one of the AI Business Services i.e. Document AI in MDG via ISLM. It is formerly known as Document Information Extraction (DIE).

MDG Scenario

The scenario is to derive the address details from vendor registration PDF document which will be uploaded in the MDG change request. SAP Document AI from BTP is used to read the details from a PDF document and derive the data into MDG change request.

Implementation

1. BTP

First of all, The BTP account is needed to create instance on the AI business service - SAP Document AI to read data from PDF. If you do not have a BTP account, please refer this link to create a BTP trial account Get an Account on SAP BTP Trial | SAP Tutorials.

You can find the SAP Document AI Trail (DIE) in the service marketplace to create an instance.

Please make sure instance as well as service key is created. The service key is used later in the ISLM connection mapping configuration.

Please subscribe to SAP Document AI UI application

Assign Role Collection to your user in Security.

To simplify all the above setup, you can use Booster as alternative to setup the SAP Document AI in BTP.

PDF Document

Please find sample PDF document which will be used as a document template to setup in the SAP Document AI.

Schema Configuration 

Create a custom schema in SAP Document AI Application to extract fields from PDF document.

Add Header Fields

Add header fields in the custom schema to map with PDF document. All the fields such as FirstName, LastName, House No, Street, postal code etc. from PDF to map with business partner fields in MDG change request.

Activate the schema after all the fields are added.

 

Create Template

Template in SAP Business AI that uses schema and associated document. You could edit the extraction results of the associated documents to teach SAP Document AI where certain field values are located on the document to improve the accuracy of the extraction.

There is no associated document, so we need to add PDF document now in Documents.

Add Document

Add the PDF document in the Documents in SAP Document AI application and map the schema fields with PDF fields.

Add this document to template

Now, click on Add to Template Button to add this document to custom template created in one of the above steps.

Activate template

Access Template on the left navigation pane to activate it.

Now, all the setup related to SAP Document AI is completed.

2. Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) in MDG System

  • ISLM is part of the ABAP Platform offered as core functionality in ABAP stack. 
  • ISLM Framework is developed in SAP BASIS Component from ABAP Platform 2020 delivery with SAP BASIS  755 / 7.8x onwards.
  • ISLM facilitates and helps to consume the Machine learning scenarios with an ABAP based Business Application seamlessly
  • ISLM helps to integrate AI and AI Business services into MDG system (S/4HANA).
  • ISLM offers an end-to-end framework to manage both pre-delivered and custom AI scenarios in SAP S/4HANA.

In this example, would like to walk through custom AI-DAR scenario through ISLM.

The below configuration is to be completed in MDG system to enable ISLM related applications.

  • Setting up the OData Services
  • Setting up the bgRFC Queue
  • Configuring Business Roles for the Backend
  • Configuring Business Roles for the Frontend

Please make sure that role SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST is assigned to the user which is required to access the below Intelligent Scenario Apps. 

 

Click on Intelligent Scenarios App to create an intelligent scenario to consume AI business service SAP Document AI (DIE).

As you may aware, SAP ISLM provides two options as Embedded and Side-by-Side. In this example, would like to cover side-by-side scenario. So, click on create Button to initiate a side-by-side scenario creation.

 

Enter Scenario Name, Description and Type as Document Information Extraction.

It is recommended to use $TMP local package in ISLM until the Intelligent scenario is developed and tested thoroughly. After finalization, create the application package specific intelligent scenario. ISLM creates 'Intelligent Scenario' as an ABAP Object (Transportable / added to a TR based on catalog/package).

Create a prediction class with interface IF_ISLM_INTS_SBS_DOCX which will be assigned in the intelligent scenario.

The intelligent scenario could be published after all the above steps are done.

Maintain connection mapping between intelligent scenario and SAP Document AI (DIE) service (BTP) using service key and oAuth profile through the transaction ISLM_CONN_MAP.

In the Intelligent scenario management App, the deployment of intelligent scenario needs to be activated.

3. Master Data Governance (MDG)

In MDG, Cross entity derivation BADI could be used to call the Document AI via ISLM in MDG change request. In the BADI, it will read the name and address details using Document AI from PDF, which is attached in the MDG CR, and it will derive this information in the CR.

Execution

To execute this scenario, attach the PDF document in the MDG CR header and select BP grouping in the CR, it will trigger the BADI to derive the name and address details from PDF to MDG change request.

The file name and file title could be any and it is not fixed to any particular name.

Now, the name and address details are derived in the CR from PDF document.

Conclusion

In this blog post, we have learnt how to derive fields in the MDG change request from PDF document using SAP Document AI via ISLM.

SECOND SCENARIO

1. CONSUMER CONTRACT DISCOUNT

S.ORG/MATERIAL OR PRODUCT HEIRARCHY/SALES TERMS/CONTRACT QTY/SHIP TO PARTY GROUP CODE OR CONSUMER CODE

CONTRACT QTY SHOULD DECIDE PERCENTAGE OF LIFTED QTY BASED ON SHIP TO PARTY GROUP CODE QUANTITY AND PICK DISCOUNT SLAB BASED ON PERCENTAGE.

SHIP TO PARTY GROUP CODE OR CODE WILL DECIDE REAL LIFTING QUANTITY.

 
  1. DEALER CONTRACTUAL DISCOUNT BASED ON BASIC PRICE

S.ORG/MATERIAL OR PRODUCT HEIRARCHY/SALES TERMS/BASIC PRICE/ CONTRACT QTY/PAYER GROUP CODE OR CODE

BASIC PRICE WILL DECIDE DISCOUNT SLAB BASED ON BASIC PRICE DISCOUNT SLAB.

CONTRACT QTY SHOULD DECIDE PERCENTAGE OF LIFTED QTY BASED ON PAYER GROUP CODE QUANTITY AND PICK DISCOUNT SLAB BASED ON PERCENTAGE IN REFERENCE WITH THE ABOVE BASIC PRICE.

PAYER GROUP CODE OR CODE WILL DECIDE REAL LIFTING QUANTITY.

entry.title: Internal Order Alternative in S/4HANA Public Cloud - Which Scope Item for BS Account Posting and Inv
entry.content:
In ECC, we use Internal Orders for:

1. Posting costs to BS accounts (e.g., Work in Process, Advances)
- Pool costs temporarily before allocation
- Code starting with "3"

2. Posting costs directly to P&L accounts (e.g., Cost Variances)
- Immediate expense recognition
- Code starting with "4"

3. Issuing inventory materials to these orders

We understand Internal Orders are not available in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Questions:
1. Which Scope Item(s) can replace Internal Order functionality?
- We checked 35E (R&D Project Management) but it seems to support only P&L posting

2. Can any Scope Item support:
- Posting to BS accounts for cost pooling?
- Direct material issues from inventory?

3. What is the recommended approach for our requirements?

Current usage:
- Manufacturing industry
- R&D department uses these for expense management
- Need to pool costs in BS accounts before period-end allocation

entry.title: Re: Internal Order Alternative in S/4HANA Public Cloud -...
entry.content:
Hi byd,

You can refer to scope Item: Project Financial Control (1NT) where wbs elements provide closest functionality to Internal Orders with both BS and P&L posting capabilities

Solution Components

  1. Cost Pooling Alternative

    • Use WBS elements as cost collectors for temporary cost accumulation
    • Configure project types for different business scenarios (R&D, manufacturing support)
    • Set up settlement rules for period-end allocation

  2. Material Issue Handling

    • Direct material consumption to WBS elements
    • Integration with inventory management for material withdrawals
    • Automatic goods issue posting to project costs

  3. Expense Recognition Process

    • Immediate P&L posting through cost centers for variance-type transactions
    • WBS capitalization for work-in-process scenarios
    • Flexible settlement to final cost objects

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudo. This motivates me to serve you better.

Best regards,

Bob

entry.title: Planned Depreciation for Following Month Showing Double the Expected Amount
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

After performing a fixed asset migration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) for asset transfer during the fiscal year, I noticed that the planned ordinary depreciation for the following month (e.g., period 10 â€“ October 2025) is double the expected amount.

The worksheet that I used in the Fixed Asset - Posting template is "Posting Key", "Posted Value", "Transaction Header", "Transaction Item"

Here are the key details of the migrated asset:

  • Capitalization Date: 28-Feb-2025

  • Transfer (Cut-off) Date: 30-Sep-2025

  • Useful Life: 24 months

  • Depreciation Key: Straight line to zero

  • Acquisition Value: 300,000 

  • Accumulated Depreciation (Marâ€“Sep): 87,500 (7 months Ã— 12,500)

  • Expected monthly depreciation: 12,500 (***Which should also apply for following depreciation period)

However, the Planned Depreciation for Period 10 is shown as 25,000 instead of 12,500.

Could you please explain what might cause the system to display double planned depreciation for the first period after migration?

Thank you in advance.

Best regards,
HY

SAP S/4HANA Finance

entry.title: Joule Skills: Simplifying Employee Data Updates from Chat to Case
entry.content:
ğŸŒŸ Introduction

In todayâ€™s digital workplace, employees expect quick and seamless HR support â€” whether theyâ€™re updating personal details or submitting important requests. SAP Build Joule Skills make this possible by extending SAP Joule, the generative AI copilot, with custom business logic that connects conversational experiences to enterprise systems like SAP SuccessFactors and SAP CX Service Cloud.

This blog explores how Joule Skills transform HR operations by automating co

ğŸ¤– What Are SAP Build Joule Skills?

Joule Skills are custom, AI-powered extensions that enable Joule to perform specific actions or respond intelligently within your organizationâ€™s SAP landscape. With SAP Build, you can design these skills to handle structured inputs, integrate APIs, and trigger backend processes â€” all while maintaining a natural, conversational flow.

In short, Joule Skills let you teach Joule new abilities, such as:

  • Updating employee data in SAP SuccessFactors
  • Creating service requests in SAP CX Service Cloud
  • Fetching policy or compliance details from Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs)
  • Guiding users through document uploads and validation

ğŸ§  What It Is

SAP Build Joule Skills let you teach Joule new capabilities â€” like answering company-specific questions or triggering SAP processes (e.g., updating employee details, checking sales orders, creating service requests, etc.).

Why use Joule skills in HR?

  • Remove manual steps: guide employees with just-in-time guidance and collect exactly the data HR needs.
  • Improve accuracy: structured prompts reduce missing/incorrect data.
  • Bridge chat â†’ case: automatically open service cases and attach metadata and files.
  • Track compliance: add KBA (knowledge base article) checks and required documentation prompts.

ğŸ’¼ HR Use Case: Name Change and Emergency Contact Update

Letâ€™s consider a real-world example.
Employee Jada is getting married and wants to update her last name and emergency contact details in the company HR system.

Hereâ€™s how Joule handles it seamlessly:

  1. Employee Interaction:
    Jada opens the HR portal and types,
    â€œI need to update my last name and emergency contact due to an upcoming marriage.â€

  2. Guided Workflow:
    Joule responds with relevant KBA links, explaining required documents and steps.

  3. Data Collection:
    Joule asks for:

  • New last name
  • Emergency contact name and phone number
  • Marriage date
  • Marriage certificate upload

    Joule validates the inputs and triggers backend automation to:

    • Create a service case in SAP CX Service Cloud, ensuring HR teams can track and process the update.
    • Update Jadaâ€™s profile in SAP SuccessFactors with her new personal details automatically.
    • Confirmation:
      Joule confirms submission and provides a case reference for tracking.

ğŸ§© Why Joule Skills Matter for HR

  • Reduce manual effort: Employees can initiate updates via chat without filling multiple forms.
  • Ensure accuracy: Structured prompts ensure complete and validated data.
  • Enhance compliance: Automatically check KBAs or policy documents before submission.
  • Improve employee experience: Faster resolutions and transparent status tracking.

Steps: Integrate the Process into a Joule Skill

1. Open the SAP Build Lobby, choose Sales Order Assistant Joule Skill project.

2. Click Create, then Joule Skill.

3.Enter name update_personal_details and description Allows the user to update their last name and emergency contact information due to an upcoming marriage..

4. Click Parameters and configure Skill Inputs and Skill Input as mentioned

6. Choose Add Input three times and enter the following parameters:

Case Creation Skill

Similarly, create Joule skills that can call APIs for SuccessFactors name change and case creation.

6. Choose New Conversation.

A case is automatically created in Service Cloud V2, and simultaneously, the employeeâ€™s last name is updated in SAP SuccessFactors through the integrated Joule skill

âœ… Conclusion

SAP Build Joule Skills bring intelligence and automation to everyday HR scenarios. By bridging conversational AI with SAPâ€™s core systems, they empower employees to self-serve while ensuring HR teams maintain control, compliance, and efficiency.

In our example, what used to take multiple emails and forms now happens in one smooth interaction â€” from chat to case creation to record update.
With Joule Skills, organizations can reimagine HR service delivery and bring true AI-driven automation to the heart of employee experience.

entry.title: S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios: Part-2
entry.content:
In this Part-2 blog, I will focus on the SAP Situation Handling Scenario: MAN_MATLOVERDUESITSITN (Stock Transport Order Overdue), as a continuation of Part-1 blog: S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios. 

What is Situation Handling Scenario:

In a nut shell, SAP Situation Handling Scenario helps organizations increase the quality and efficiency of the business processes by automatically detecting, tracking, and informing the right users about the exceptional circumstances that require their immediate attention. With its tracking and monitoring features, Situation Handling allows organization to get insights into the life cycle of situations and to  identify the recurring situations that can be prevented or automatically resolved.

Let us dive in...

To begin with, let us understand the Key Concepts of Situation Handling Scenario.

  • Situation Template: It serves as a blueprint for creating a situation type.
  • Situation Type: It describes the business situation. For example, how a situation instance can be triggered and who is informed about it.
  • Situation Instance: An exceptional issue which is displayed the responsible person.
  • Situation object: Technical model of a business object used in Situation Handling. It provides the basic technical configuration such as data structures, events, and actions.
  • Situation Scenario: Business Scenario that contains defining entity sets to create multiple situation templates.

Disclaimer: This blog focuses on the Situation Handling Standard Framework and SAP provided date functions.

Let us now understand the process flow of the Situation Handling Scenario.

If you want to gain deeper understanding of SAP Signavio Process Manager & Process Collaboration Hub, dive into my blog post on SAP Signavio : The nuts and bolts of a well-thought-out SAP Signavio : Process Manager & Process Collaboration Hub 

I will be walking you through the highlighted Apps  below during the Stock Transport Order Overdue Situation Handling Scenario process.

Let us first configure "Responsibility Management".

In "Responsibility Management", the team category represents a business process. In our case, the team category is "Inventory Management Overdue Monitoring (INVOVDUEMO)". SAP provides a list of standard team categories.

Team attributes are represented as "Responsibility Definition". 

Responsible Teams to receive exception notifications.

Let us move on to "Manage Situation Types".

In the standard framework, situation templates for object-based situations are predefined by SAP. We have to copy the situation type that can be adapted and enabled for productive usage. Enabled situation types create situation instances, send exception notifications, and display the situation message.

Let us copy the situation template: "MAN_MALOVERDUESITSITN" and create a Situation Type: "ZMAN_MALOVERDUESITSITN - Stock Transport Order Overdue".

When situation occurs, the system displays the message as:

In this section let us define the conditions based on which the system creates the situation instances and for which of these instances notifications are sent. Conditions are copied from the situation template when we create a situation type. However, the conditions can be configured by adding filter values. We can use input help to define multiple values for each date field.

We can select the time zone for scheduling to trigger situation instances based on the defined conditions. If this section is not displayed, then the situation type is even based. 

To enable "Notifications", assign the "Teams" to the situation type. 

With the "Trigger Now" option in the header section, we can directly initiate the batch process. As soon as the batch job is finished, we can see the new instances in the situation instances list.

We will now proceed to create STO for the material 271-Air Compressor 1250 CFM 8KG/CM2 SL200 movement from Norco plant to Robinson plant by recording the truck`s Inward and outward movements for this shipment.

Stock Transport Order:

As per the conditions configured in the Situation Handling Scenario : ZMAN_MALOVERDUESITSITN - Stock Transport Order Overdue, the system should alert the responsible team if the days in transit for the STO: 4500000334 is > 1 day.

When the days in transit for the STO: 4500000334 was "Null", the system did not trigger the notification.

Now, let us create "Outbound Delivery" for the STO 4500000334 and perform "Goods Issue" transaction referencing the Outbound Delivery. 

Stock Transport Order Quantities and Timeline:

We have also recorded the truck`s Inward and Outward movements for this shipment at Norco Plant.

When the days in transit for the STO: 4500000334 was "1", system did not trigger the notification.

As the "Days in Transit" reaches to "2", the system alerts the responsible team that has been assigned to the situation handling scenario. In our use case, the STO 4500000334 was delayed and met the conditions that are part of situation handling scenario; hence, the system triggered the exception notification.

The situations are displayed at "Bell Icon", which is a gate way to the SAP Fiori notification center.

or we can use "App ID: F4154 (My Situations app) " to monitor exception notifications. 

Now, the responsible team member shall coordinate with the team and resolve the issues related to the delay. For Instance, let us assume that, the truck has reached the location on early hours 27/10/2025, but the Inward entry was not recorded due to space constraint at the plant. Now, the team has cleared the space and recorded the "Gate Entry".

Inward Movement Entry at Robinson Plant:

Now, let us close the STO 4500000334 by recording "Goods Receipt Transaction". Responsible team can use the exception notification generated by the situation handling scenario and access the link to post the goods receipt by referencing the STO 4500000334

Now, let`s use My Situations App to view the exception notification for the STO 4500000334 and post the Goods receipt.

When we navigate through the exception message in the "My Situations" App, the system automatically copies the STO details into the selection screen field values.

Process flow of the STO up to the Goods Issue point.

We can use the populated link to post the "Goods Receipt" for the STO at the Robinson Plant.

We can attach the approval document for the movement of the Asset 20000000(EQ:10000001) while recording the Goods Receipt against STO: 4500000334.

Following the successful completion of the Goods Receipt, the STO 4500000334 is displayed under the "Delivery Completed" tab.

Let us now view the process flow of the Asset 20000000 movement from Norco Plant to Robinson Plant.

Following the successful completion of the Asset 20000000 movement, we can now close the "Situation" by using the option "Close Situation".

Let us now monitor the situations.

With this Analytical List Page App, we can monitor the handling of standard object-based situations with respect to their status and related business objects.

 

ğŸ˜ŠThis brings me to the end of a detailed process walkthrough on SAP Situation Handling Scenario for the "Stock Transport Order Overdue". I hope this blog proves useful to the Inventory Management Team in gaining nuanced understanding of how to set up the situation handling scenario that triggers material movement exceptions during the Stock Transport Order process.

If you want to gain a deeper understanding of SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management and how it can be set up to predict the "Forecast Delivery Date" in the Stock Transport Order process, check out my latest blog by accessing the link below.

S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios: Part-1 

 

--

Yours Sincerely,

Pardhasaradhi Reddy.C

entry.title: Re: Signature Type (AES/SES/QES) for SAP E-Signature in O...
entry.content:
@Shoaib2220 Based on my understanding :Native method e-sign will fall under SES category .(A Simple Electronic Signature (SES) method involves using a basic electronic representation of a signature for low-risk transactions. This includes actions like typing a name, inserting a scanned image of a signature, or clicking "I Agree" on a web form).

It will not belong to AES and QES.

AES(created using electronic signature creation data (a private key) that the signatory can, with a high level of confidence, use under his sole control) 

 QES (is created by a qualified electronic signature creation device (QESCD) (Article 22, eIDAS). For example, a physical smartcard held by the signer with an associated pin code or hardware security module operated remotely by a qualified trust service provider (QTSP) in the cloud).

I would defer it our ONB experts @smitajalit @Shelly_Allen to confirm on it once.

Thanks,

Gopi

entry.title: Build Action to connect to RAP Odata in SAP BTP Trial Account - Forbidden: 403

entry.title: How to avoid the overlapping errors in SuccessFactors timesheet?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a time tracking enabled system.

Our client is into manufacturing sector. We have employees working on 24/7 shifts. There are high chances of shift adjustments. 

Ex:- There is an employee 10000, this employee's planned shift is B shift from 14:00 to 22:00, There is another employee 10001, this employees planned shift is A Shift from 06:00 to 14:00. Due to some adjustment the employee 10000 asked by the manager to come in A shift and the employee 10001 to come in B shift on 1st Sep 2025.

But, Manager is forgot to update the temporary changes in the shift schedules of the employees in the SuccessFactors system.

The employees are following the manager orders and punching the clock In and Clock Out, the data is sent to timesheet by using integration. We have time valuations built in the time recording profile to process the data into different time type groups.

At the end of the month on 30th Sep 2025, the manager realized that the data processed by the time valuations is incorrect and also realized that he forgot to do the temporary shift changes. Now, the manager is updating the temporary changes of 1st Sep 2025, for the employee 10000 manager assigned A shift and for the employee 10001 B shift. 

We have many cases similar to the above example on different dates in Sep month.

Hence, our integration team has re-ran the integration job for the entire month. After successful completion of the integration job we validated the attendance data in the timesheet on 1st Sep 2025 for employee 10000 and 10001, we are getting the below error.

"Your time sheet entries were not successfully imported from an external system. Please contact your administrator. Reason: Resolve overlapping time sheet entries on 01-Sep-2025. Make sure there is only one time entry between 06:01 and 06:02. If you record night shifts, check the previous and the next week of the time sheet for possible overlaps. If you have edited an approved time sheet, please contact your system administrator."

I understand about the error, this is happened because of the delay in the temporary shift adjustment in the employee work schedule and also due to the execution of the integration (CPI) job multiple times.

How to avoid these overlapping issues? Is there a way to delete the timesheet data either by CPI or by Imports from SF for that entire month and run the integration job again? What is the correct process to follow before re-run of the CPI job?

Please provide us your inputs.

Many Thanks

SAH

entry.title: IBP Integration Using SAP Cloud Integration: Fetch Product MD from addon extractor and load to IBP
entry.content:
Hello Community,

This blog is about creating a custom Iflow in Integration Suite to fetch Product Master Data from S/4HANA system using IBP add-on extractor /IBP/PRODUCT_ATTR and load into IBP

==============================================================================================

Prerequisites

1.Communication arrangement (SAP_COM_0931) is configured in IBP.

2.S/4HANA system is configured in Cloud connector.

3.Add IBP system and S/4HANA system as Destinations in BTP sub-account as shown in Picture (a).

Picture (a)

=======================================================================================

Creating custom iflow for Product Interface:

STEP1: As Pre-requisites - deploy reusable preconfigured integration packages from Discover section as shown in Picture (b).

          SAP IBP - Reusable Integration Flows

          SAP IBP Add-On - Reusable Integration Flows

Picture (b)

STEP2: Create a new content package from Design Section as shown in Picture (c).

Picture (c)

STEP3: From the newly created package, add Integration Flow in Artifacts section as shown in Picture (d).

Picture (d)

 

STEP4: As part of basic integration setup - add Content Modifier in Picture (e) and Request-Reply in Picture (f). Content Modifier is used to input the extraction parameters required for data fetching and Request-Reply is used for communicating with S/4HANA system, where the integration flow sends a request and waits for a response before continuing. 

Picture (e)

Picture (f)

 

STEP5: Parameters are defined in Content Modifier > Message Body as shown in Picture (g).

Picture (g)

 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<IBPRead
BatchCommand = "INSERT_UPDATE"
BatchName = "IBP_PRODUCT_MD"
BatchKey = "PRDID"
DataSource = "/IBP/PRODUCT_ATTR"
DestinationforAddon = "S4_DML"
DestinationforSAPIBP = "IBP_Internal_UWE100"
FieldMapping = "PRDID:PRDID,PRDGROUP:PRDGROUP,UOMID:UOMID"
FilterForTheDataSource = "PRDID EQ 'ASMBLY-001-TEST10' "
PlanningArea = "ZDMIBP1"
SourceFieldsfromAddon = "PRDID,PRDGROUP,UOMID"
TargetFieldsInSAPIBP = "PRDID,PRDGROUP,UOMID"
TypeOfData = "MASTERDATA"
MasterDataPrefix = "DM1"
MasterDataType = "PRODUCT"
/>

STEP6: Select Adapter Type as Process Direct to link Request Reply to the Receiver.  Enter the full technical ID of the reusable iflow in the Address field. This will call reusable Iflows - SAP IBP Add-On Read â€“ Generic Process Flow to read data from the add-on extractors and to transfer data into SAP IBP as shown in Picture (h).

Picture (h)

STEP7: Save and Deploy the newly created iflow as shown in Picture (i). 

Please note here the trigger mechanism is set to start the iflow/data extraction during deployment.

Picture (i)

STEP8: Product object deployed successfully as shown in Picture (j).

Picture (j)

STEP8: Monitor the iflow activities in Monitor > Integrations and API > Overview > Monitor Message Processing as shown in Picture (k).

Picture (k)

STEP9: Output data can be located in IBP > Data Integration > Data Integration Jobs as shown in Picture (l)

Picture (l)

STEP10: Compare the data in source extractor Picture (m) and target IBP Picture (n)

Picture (m)

Picture (n)

 

===========================================================================================

Summary

After reading this blog, you will be able to integrate IBP Master Data objects using IBP addon extractors as source and load into IBP planning area using Integration suite.  Here we used Product MD object with limited source attributes and mapped it to target IBP Product MD. Filter is used based on single PRDID. 

Similar iflows can be built for any master data objects like Customer, Location, Location Product etc.

===========================================================================================

Like what youâ€™ve read? Please share your thoughts, questions and feedback. Feel free to share on Facebook, Twitter, or LinkedIn using the super-easy share buttons at the bottom! And donâ€™t forget to follow Cloud Integration & SAP IBP @ SAP Community for more content like this.

Cloud Integration SAP Integration Suite SAP Integrated Business Planning SAP ERP, supply chain integration add-on for SAP Integrated Business Planning

entry.title: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Belgium: Electronic Invoice in Utilities using Extensibility
entry.content:
You want to enable your system to create electronic documents for invoices posted in Utilities using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. In this blog, weâ€™ll show you an example on how this can be achieved using extensibility.  

Before you begin ensure that you have implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2424886 - Electronic Document Processing for Belgium: Implementation Overview. You can also refer the SAP Help Portal for more information, see Electronic Document Processing.
Ensure you have also implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2736880 - eDocument EU PEPPOL: Overview note for IS-U.

Steps to Create Electronic Documents

  • Create eDocument Class
    1. Create 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class by inheriting CL_EDOCUMENT_EU_ISU class.
    2. Add the CONSTRUCTOR method in the ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU eDocument class to map the 'Z' eDocument IS-U class name to the field ms_edocument-edocument_class.â€¯
    3. Redefine the method DETERMINE_PROCESS to assign the processes BEINV and BEINVIN.
    4. Use the table TFK003EDOC to configure eDocument type against the accounting document type.
    Example:

    Country/Region 

    Application Area 

    Document Type 

    eDocument Type 

    IN 

    Utility Company 

    FA 

    BE_INV 

    â€¯5. Add the class CL_EDOC_PROCESS as Friends of 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class.â€¯

    Sample Code for CONSTRUCTOR and DETERMINE_PROCESS method:  
    Constructor method signature: 

METHOD constructor.
 super->constructor( io_source_data                 = io_source_data
                      iv_edoc_guid                   = iv_edoc_guid
                      iv_land                        = iv_land
                      iv_update_task                 = iv_update_task
                      iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor = iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor
                      iv_simulate_for_email_option = iv_simulate_for_email_option ).

  ms_edocument-land                   = 'BE'.
  ms_edocument-edocument_class        = 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU'.
ENDMETHOD.
METHOD determine_process.
    CASE ms_edocument-edoc_type.
      WHEN 'BE_INVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process = 'BEINVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
      WHEN OTHERS.
        CASE ms_edocument-interface_type.
          WHEN 'AIF_PROXY' OR 'STANDARD'.
            ms_edocument-process = 'BEINV'.
*           reference process is 'EUINV'
            ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
          WHEN OTHERS.
            MESSAGE e162(edocument) INTO gv_error_txt.
            raise_edoc_exception( ).
        ENDCASE.
    ENDCASE.
ENDMETHOD.

 

  • Create Factory Class
    1. Create a 'Z' factory class to get the instance of eDocument IS-U class by inheriting CL_EDOC_FACTORY class and redefine its method CREATE_EDOC_INSTANCE. 
    Example: ZCL_EDOC_FACTORY_BE_ISU
    2. Configure this 'Z' eDocument factory class in the view EDOFACTORYV using the transaction SM30.

    Source Typeâ€¯ 

    Factory Classâ€¯ 

    ISU_INVOICâ€¯ 

    â€˜Zâ€™ factory class name (your factory class that you just created)â€¯ 


    Sample Code:
METHOD create_edoc_instances.

    DATA: lv_land_iso      TYPE edoc_land,
          lv_error_txt     TYPE string,
          ls_source_header TYPE edoc_src_header,
          lo_edocument     TYPE REF TO zcl_edocument_be_isu.

    CLEAR: lv_land_iso,
           lv_error_txt,
           ls_source_header,
           lo_edocument,
           et_edocument_obj.

* Country
    ls_source_header = io_source->get_header( ).
    CALL FUNCTION 'COUNTRY_CODE_SAP_TO_ISO'
      EXPORTING
        sap_code  = ls_source_header-land
      IMPORTING
        iso_code  = lv_land_iso
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found = 1
        OTHERS    = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE e881(b1) WITH ls_source_header-land INTO lv_error_txt.
    ENDIF.
    IF lv_land_iso <> 'BE'.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    CREATE OBJECT lo_edocument 
      EXPORTING
        io_source_data = io_source
        iv_update_task = iv_update_task.

    APPEND lo_edocument TO et_edocument_obj.

  ENDMETHOD.

  • Mapping Class
    1. We have a generic mapping class CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU. If you need to enhance the mapping logic, you can use the EDOC_ADAPTOR BAdI's method SET_OUTPUT_DATA. For more details, refer to Enhancements for Electronic Documents.
    Alternatively, you can implement your own custom mapping class. 
    2. Configure your mapping class in the view EDOMAPCLASSDETV using the transaction SM30.â€¯
    Example:

    eDocument Process 

    Version 

    Interface ID 

    eDocument Type 

    Source Type 

    Mapping Class 

    EUINV 

    1 

    UBL_INVOICE_TRANSM

    BE_INV 

    ISU_INVOIC 

    <Your Z mapping class or CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU> 

     

  • Maintain the Required Customizations
    Apart from maintaining Master Data, Customizing and Integration as explained in the SAP Help Portal, you must also configure the company code for the following IS-U source type.

    1.  Activate company code for ISU_INVOIC source type in the view EDOCOMPANYACTIV for eDocument creation.
    Example:

    Company Codeâ€¯ 

    Source Typeâ€¯ 

    Application Activeâ€¯ 

    <Your company code>â€¯ 

    ISU_INVOICEâ€¯ 

    Xâ€¯ 


By following these steps, you can efficiently create electronic documents for invoices in the utilities sector, ensuring compliance and enhancing operational efficiency. 

Don't forget to test it thoroughly. 

We hope this blog post was useful for you! You can leave a comment here or continue browsing ourâ€¯communityâ€¯for more blog posts on SAP Document and Reporting Compliance topics. 

Looking forward to seeing you here again!
